descr.name: qHTS assay to identify small molecule agonists of the estrogen receptor alpha (ER-alpha) signaling pathway: Summary
description: U.S. Tox21 Program
National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences [NCATS]
NIH Chemical Genomics Center [NCGC]
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency [EPA]
National Institutes of Environmental Health Sciences [NIEHS]
National Toxicology Program [NTP]
U.S. Food and Drug Administration [FDA]
Tox21 Assay Overview:

Estrogen receptor (ER), a nuclear hormone receptor, plays an important role in development, metabolic homeostasis and reproduction. Two subtypes of ER, ER-alpha and ER-beta have similar expression patterns with some uniqueness in both types. Endocrine disrupting chemicals (EDCs) and their interactions with steroid hormone receptors like ER causes disruption of normal endocrine function. To identify the compounds that activate ER-alpha signaling, an ER-alpha-UAS-bla GripTiteTM cell line (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) containing a beta-lactamase reporter gene under the control of an Upstream Activator Sequence (UAS) stably integrated into HEK293 cells was used to screen the Tox21 10K compound library.
protocol: Please refer to other AIDs 743075, 720687, 720685, 720678 and 720681, for detailed assay protocols.
comment: This summary is written for the purposes of summarizing the compound activities from the project combining the results from both the ER-alpha agonist mode assay (AID 743075) and auto fluorescence counter screens (AIDs 720687, 720685, 720678 and 720681). For all inactive compounds, PUBCHEM_ACTIVITY_SCORE is 0. Active compounds have PUBCHEM_ACTIVITY_SCORE between 40 and 100. Potency and efficacy were used for determining relative score. Inconclusive compounds have PUBCHEM_ACTIVITY_SCORE between 5 and 30 determined by phenotype.

Although all reasonable efforts have been made to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data, caution should be exercised when interpreting the results as artifacts are possible from nonspecific effects such as assay signal interference. The curve fitting and activity calls presented here are based on the NCATS analysis methods. Alternative analysis methods and interpretations of the data are available at EPA (http://actor.epa.gov) and NTP (http://tools.niehs.nih.gov/cebs3/ui/).

results.name: Activity Summary
description: Type of compound activity based on both the ER-alpha agonist mode screen and the auto fluorescence counter screens.

results.name: Ratio Activity
description: Type of compound activity in the ratio readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: Ratio Potency (uM)
description: The concentration of sample yielding half-maximal activation in the ratio readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: Ratio Efficacy (%)
description: Percent activation in the ratio readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 530 nm Activity
description: Type of compound activity in the 530 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 530 nm Potency (uM)
description: The concentration of sample yielding half-maximal activation in the 530 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 530 nm Efficacy (%)
description: Percent activation in the 530 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 460 nm Activity
description: Type of compound activity in the 460 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 460 nm Potency (uM)
description: The concentration of sample yielding half-maximal activation in the 460 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: 460 nm Efficacy (%)
description: Percent activation in the 460 nm readout of the ER-alpha agonist mode screen.

results.name: Blue (460 nm) auto fluorescence outcome
description: Type of compound activity in the auto fluorescence counter screens.
